pullRequest.title: support lazy loading for one-to-one references

nodes.bodyText: I thought this was done in the previous PR, but I guess we missed it somehow.
Should we log a warning if callbacks length is > 1? Is this a "this should never happen" scenario?
Is there anything we could say about the difference between treatment of collections, interfaces and objects in the javadoc?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -63,7 +83,7 @@ public static boolean isLazyAndNotLoaded(Object object) {
 	 * @param object a proxy object
 	 * @return list of keys if the object is a proxy, null otherwise
 	 */

nodes.bodyText: Is this going to also go through the collection path (similar to saveTestCollectionLazy)?
does this have the same problem that we had in previous PR where the equality does not necessarily prove anything?
